<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
<I>
	Technology
	Integration services:
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</FONT>
	Our mix of solutions give us the scope to band and extend any or all of these
	services in multiple formats and scales for client who wish to rest their entire infrastructure with us. Clients get the benefit
	of our accumulated knowledge base and technical expertise across all points of the ICT spectrum. In terms of cost, these translate
	into better cost efficiencies. In terms of monitoring, the client need to interact with a singular service provider saving them
	both implementation and documentation efforts.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
<I>
	Applications
	Integration service:
</I>
</B>
	Our range of web-applications includes sales force automation, supply chain management, intranet and
	extranets, workflow engine and knowledge management systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Our
	Applications Integration services operates two of India&rsquo;s biggest online portals,&nbsp;
<U>
	www.sify.com and www.samachar.com
</U>
	,
	that function as principal entry points and gateway for accessing the Internet by providing useful web-related services and links.
	We also offer related content sites specifically tailored to Indian interests worldwide.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Sify.com
	provides a gateway to the Internet by offering communication and search tools such as email, chat, travel, online portfolio management
	and channels for personal finance, astrology, lifestyle, shopping, movies, sports and news.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	We
	offer value-added services to organizations such as website design, development, content management, Online assessment tools, search
	engine optimization, including domain name management, secure socket layer (SSL) certificate for websites, and server space in
	required operating system and database. We provide state of the art messaging and collaboration services and solutions such as
	e-mail servers, LAN mail solutions, anti-spam appliances, bulk mail services, instant messaging, and also offer solutions and services
	to enable data and access security over the Internet. We also provide infrastructure-based services on demand, including on-line
	testing engine and network management. On-line testing services include test management software, required servers and proctored
	examination facilities at Sify&rsquo;s franchisee points. On-line exam engine offered allows a secure and flexible way of conducting
	examinations involving a wide range of question patterns.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	There are numerous
	risks and challenges affecting the business. These risks and challenges are discussed in detail in the section entitled 'Risk Factors'
	and elsewhere in this Annual Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Telecom Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	These
	primarily include revenue from connectivity services, NLD/ILD services and to a lesser extent, revenues from the installation of
	the connectivity link. In certain cases, these elements are sold as a package consisting of all or some of the elements. We sell
	hardware and software purchased from third party vendors to our high value corporate clients. Our connectivity services include
	IPVPN services, Internet connectivity and last mile connectivity (predominantly through wireless). We provide these services for
	a fixed period of time at a fixed rate regardless of usage, with the rate for the services determined based on the type of service
	and capacity provided, scope of the engagement and the Service Level Agreement, or SLA. We provide NLD (National Long Distance)
	and ILD (International Long Distance) services and carry voice traffic for Inter-connect Operators. Revenue is recognized based
	upon metered call units of voice traffic terminated on our network.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Data Centre
	services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenue
	from Data Centre services includes revenue from co-location of space, racks and caged racks and on usage of power from large contracts.
	The contracts are mainly fixed rate for a period of time based on the space or the racks used and usage revenue is based on consumption
	of power on large contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Cloud and Managed
	Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Revenue
	from Cloud and Managed services, are primarily from &ldquo;Cloud and on demand storage&rdquo;, &ldquo;Domestic managed services
	and &ldquo; International managed services&rdquo;. Contracts from Cloud and on demand storage, are primarily fixed and for a period
	of time. Revenues from Domestic and International managed services, comprises of value added services, operations and maintenance
	of projects and from remote infrastructure management. Contracts from this segment are fixed and could also be based on T&amp;M.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Technology
	Integration Service (TIS)
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Revenues
	from TIS comprises of DC build services, Security services and from sale of Digital certificates. Contracts under TIS are based
	on completion of projects and could also be based on T &amp; M.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Applications
	Integration Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Revenue
	from Applications Integration Services (Apps SI) comprises of Online Assessment, Web development, supply chain solutions and content
	management. Contracts are primarily fixed in nature for a period of time and also could be based on T &amp; M.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Expenses
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	Cost of goods
	sold and services rendered
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Telecom Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Cost
	of goods sold and services rendered for the corporate network/data services division consists of telecommunications costs necessary
	to provide services and cost of goods in respect of communication hardware and security services sold, commission paid to franchisees
	and cable television operators, the cost of voice termination for voice and VoIP services and other direct costs. Telecommunications
	costs include the costs of international bandwidth procured from TELCOs and are required for access to the Internet, providing
	leased lines to our points of presence, the costs of using third-party networks pursuant to service agreements, leased
	line costs and costs towards spectrum fees payable to the Wireless Planning Commission or WPC for provision of spectrum to enable
	connectivity to be provided on the wireless mode for the last mile. Other costs include cost incurred towards annual maintenance
	contract, the cost of installation in connectivity business and the costs incurred in providing Hosting services. In addition,
	the Government of India levies an annual license fee of 8% of the adjusted gross revenue generated from IP-VPN services and Voice
	services under the NLD/ILD license.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Data Centre
	Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Cost
	of goods sold and services rendered for the Data Centre services consists of cost of electrical power consumed, cost of rental
	servers offered to customers and cost of licences used to provide services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Cloud and Managed
	Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Cost
	of goods sold and services rendered for the Cloud and Managed services consists of cost of licences in providing services, cost
	of billable resources in case of International Managed services, Third party professionals engaged in providing services, associate
	costs of the delivery teams and cost of operations of DC build BOT projects.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Technology
	Integration Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Cost
	of goods sold and services rendered consists of cost of hardware and software supplied for DC build projects, cost of digital certificates
	and platform usage, cost of security hardware and software supplied and cost of hardware and software procured for System integration
	projects
<I>
	.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<I>
	Applications
	Integration Services
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Cost
	of goods sold and services rendered consists of professional charges payable to domain specialists and subject matter experts,
	cost of billable associates of e-learning business, cost of operating in third party facility for online assessment including invigilator
	costs and cost of procuring and managing content for the websites and other direct costs for the revenue streams.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Selling, general and administrative
	expenses
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Selling, general and
	administrative expenses consists of salaries and commissions for sales and marketing personnel, salaries and related costs for
	executive, financial and administrative personnel, advertising and other brand building costs, travel costs, and occupancy and
	overhead costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Depreciation and amortization
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We depreciate our tangible
	assets on a straight-line basis over the useful life of assets, ranging from three to eight years and, in the case of buildings,
	28 years. Undersea cable capacity is amortised over a period of 12 years and other intangible assets with finite lives are amortised
	over three to five years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Impairment
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The carrying amounts
	of the Group&rsquo;s non-financial assets, other than inventories and deferred tax assets are reviewed at each reporting date to
	determine whether there is any indication of impairment. If any such indication exists, then the asset&rsquo;s recoverable amount
	is estimated. For goodwill, the recoverable amount is estimated each year at December 31.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The recoverable amount
	of an asset or cash-generating unit is the greater of its value in use and its fair value less costs to sell. In assessing value
	in use, the estimated future cash flows are discounted to their present value using a pre-tax discount rate that reflects current
	market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset. For the purpose of impairment testing, assets
	that cannot be tested individually are grouped together into the smallest group of assets that generates cash inflows from continuing
	use that are largely independent of the cash inflows of other assets or groups of assets (the &ldquo;cash-generating unit&rdquo;).
	The goodwill acquired in a business combination, for the purpose of impairment testing, is allocated to cash-generating units that
	are expected to benefit from the synergies of the combination. Corporate assets for the purpose of impairment testing are allocated
	to the cash generating units on a reasonable and consistent basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	An impairment loss
	is recognized if the carrying amount of an asset or its cash-generating unit exceeds its estimated recoverable amount. Impairment
	losses are recognized in profit or loss. Impairment losses recognized in respect of cash-generating units are allocated first to
	reduce the carrying amount of any goodwill allocated to the units and then to reduce the carrying amount of the other assets in
	the unit or group of units on a
<I>
	pro rata basis.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Inventories
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Inventories comprising
	traded hardware and software are measured at the lower of cost (determined using first-in first-out principle) and net realizable
	value. Net realizable value is the estimated selling price in the ordinary course of business, less the estimated costs of completion
	and selling expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Deferred tax
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Deferred tax is recognized
	using the balance sheet method, providing for temporary differences between the carrying amount of assets and liabilities for financial
	reporting purposes and the amounts used for taxation purposes. Deferred tax is not recognized for the following temporary differences:
	the initial recognition of assets or liabilities in a transaction that is not a business combination and that affects neither accounting
	nor taxable profit or loss, and differences relating to investments in subsidiaries and associates to the extent that it is probable
	that they will not reverse in the foreseeable future. In addition, deferred tax is not recognized for taxable temporary differences
	arising on the initial recognition of goodwill, as the same is not deductible for tax purposes. Deferred tax is measured at the
	tax rates that are expected to be applied to temporary differences when they reverse, based on the laws that have been enacted
	or substantively enacted by the reporting date. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are offset if there is a legally enforceable
	right to offset current tax liabilities and assets, and they relate to income taxes levied by the same tax authority on the same
	taxable entity, or on different tax entities, but they intend to settle current tax liabilities and assets on a net basis or their
	tax assets and liabilities will be realized simultaneously.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Deferred tax arising on investments in
	subsidiaries and associates is recognized except where the Group is able to control the reversal of the temporary difference and
	it is probable that the temporary difference will not reverse in the foreseeable future. Deferred tax arising on the temporary
	differences arising out of undistributed earnings of the equity method accounted investee is recorded based on the management's
	intention. If the intention is to realize the undistributed earnings through sale, deferred tax is measured at the capital gains
	tax rates that are expected to be applied to temporary differences when they reverse. However, when the intention is to realize
	the undistributed earnings through dividend, the Group&rsquo;s share of the income and expenses of the equity method accounted
	investee is recorded in the statement of income, after considering any taxes on dividend payable by the equity method accounted
	investee and no deferred tax is set up in the Group's books as the tax liability is not with the group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Stock compensation expense
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	A total of 25 million
	equity shares are reserved for issuance under our Associate Stock Option Plans (ASOPs). Our ASOP 2014 was adopted at the Eighteenth
	Annual General Meeting held on July 28, 2014. As of March 31, 2016, we had an aggregate outstanding of 5.67 million options under
	our ASOP with a weighted average exercise price equal to approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	79.10 ($1.19) per equity share. Unamortized stock
	compensation expense as of March 31, 2016 on these options is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	30.68 million ($ 0.46 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Year 2015-16 had a 17% growth with an increase
	in revenues of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	2,170 million ($32.71 million) contributed largely by Telecom Services with a revenue growth of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,088
	million ($16.4 million), Technology Integration services with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	572 million ($8.62 million), Data Centre Services with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	247
	million ($3.72 million) and Cloud and Managed Services with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	319 million ($4.80 million). The increase is offset by decrease
	in revenue from Applications Integration Services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	56 million ($0.84 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The revenue by operating segments is as
	follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Telecom Service increased
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,088 million ($16.4 million) primarily due to (i) an increase in revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	369 million ($5.6 million) from Connectivity
	Services, contributed by net increase in number of links by 7,264 with existing and new customer engagements, and (ii) an increase
	in revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	719 million ($10.8 million) in Voice Services, which is on account of an increase of`
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	739 million ($11.15
	million) from ILD business, contributed by volume increase of 236 million minutes, partially offset by reduction of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	20 million
	($0.3 million) from VoIP services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Data Centre Services increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	247 million ($3.72 million) due to increase of new contracts and capacities sold from our new data center.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Cloud and Managed Services
	increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	319 million ($4.81 million), primarily on account of an increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	23 million ($0.4 million) from cloud
	based offerings on account of new customer engagements and increase in Infrastructure managed services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	296 million ($4.46
	million) due to increase in customer engagements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Technology Integration Services
	increased
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	572 million ($8.62 million), on account of increase in revenues from large network integration, security services
	and DC build contracts by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	654 million ($9.86 million) and partially offset by reduction of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	82 million ($1.23 million)
	from digital certification.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenue
	from Applications Integration Services decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	56 million ($0.84 million). The decrease is attributable to decrease in (i)
	revenue by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	64 million ($0.96 million) from SAP and App-led SI and (ii) Portals business by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	41 million ($0.62 million) on account
	of decrease in customer engagements. (iii) Online Assessment services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	5 million ($0.07 million).The decrease is partially
	offset by increase in e Learning business by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	54 million ($0.8 million) on account of increase in customer engagements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The increase in other income is on account
	of increase in rental income by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	28.3 million ($0.43 million) and a provision for expenses amounting to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	49.9 million
	($0.75 million) written back during current year. The increase is offset by decrease in write back of deposits/advances no longer
	required by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	41.6 million ($ 0.63 million) and reimbursements of investor related expense to our ADS programs by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	25 million ($ 0.38 million).
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Network costs comprises cost of Bandwidth
	leased out from TELCOS, Inter connect charges and IP termination costs payable to carriers. Increase in Network costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,041
	million ($15.69 million) is due to (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	212 million ($3.2 million) increase in Bandwidth costs incurred on account of capacity
	upgrades and newer links and (ii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	829 million ($12.5 million) of Inter connect charges due to the increase of 236 million
	minutes in the volume of International Long distance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue share cost comprises revenue share
	payable to DOT on licensed services. Increase in revenue share is on account of increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	54 million ($0.8 million) in
	the revenue share payable to DOT on account of increase in licensed Revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cost of Goods sold consists of cost of
	Hardware and Software and integration services. Cost of Hardware and Software sold decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	54 million ($0.8 million).
	The same being on account of decrease in projects in Technology Integration business by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	129 million ($1.9 million) which
	is partially offset by increase in cost related to one time sales by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	75 million ($1.1 million)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Direct Resource costs comprises the cost
	of resources deployed on the Network Infrastructure Delivery (Part of Telecom service), and resources involved in delivery of
	applications integration services, cost of billable resources of e Learning (Part of Applications Integration services) and Infrastructure
	Managed services (Part of Cloud and Managed Services). Increase in resources costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	148
	million ($2.2 million) is primarily on account of increase of (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	70
	million ($1.06 million) increase in delivery telecom services, (ii) Applications Integration Services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	33
	million ($0.50 million) (iii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	28 million ($0.42 million) in resource
	cost of Managed Services Delivery (Part of Cloud and Managed services), (iv) Technology Integration Services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	14
	million ($0.21 million) and (v) DC services increase by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	3 million ($0.05
	million) on account of increase in number of employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Power cost comprises of electricity charges
	incurred for our Data Centre operations. Power cost increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	131 million
	($2 million) due to increase in occupancy of Noida DC and also increase in consumption in existing Data centers and increased
	power tariff.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other direct cost, comprises Link implementation
	and maintenance charges pertaining to Telecom services, direct cost of Applications Integration services business, digital certificate
	platform, content costs and subject matter experts for international businesses. The increase in other direct costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	57
	million ($0.9 million) is primarily on account of increase of (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	17 million ($0.3 million) in applications integrations
	services on account of operating cost of online assessment and cost of delivering large projects (ii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	72 million ($1.1 million)
	on account of operating costs of cloud and managed services and.(iii) decrease of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	32 million ($0.5 million) on account of
	lower link maintenance charges.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Selling, General and Administrative
	expenses
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Selling, General and Administrative expenses
	of the Company by nature of expenses are set forth as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating costs includes rental, repairs
	and maintenance charges of our network operating centers, base stations and other co-location sites including the rent and maintenance
	for our Data Centres. Operating costs decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	8 million ($0.12 million) primarily on account of decrease in repairs
	and maintenance and network operating cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Selling and Marketing expenses consist
	of, selling commission payable to sales partners, incentive to salesmen and, marketing and promotion costs. The increase in Selling
	and Marketing expenses is on account of increase in marketing spend.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Associate expenses, consists of cost of
	the employees who are part of the Sales and marketing, Business development, General management and support services. Associate
	expenses increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	334 million ($5.04 million) between two periods due to increase in headcount.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other indirect expense consists of, rental
	and electricity cost of office, travel cost, legal charges, professional charges, communication and others.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Allowance for doubtful
	receivables/advances consists of the charge on account of the provisions created during the year against doubtful
	receivables/advances. Allowance for doubtful receivables/advances decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	79 million ($1.19 million) between two
	periods primarily on account of reduction in provision for doubtful advances.

	`

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Finance income:
</B>
	The finance income
	primarily consists of interest received from bank deposits of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	28 million ($0.42 million), and interest income on other deposits
	of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	17 million ($0.26 million). The interest received from bank decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	4 million ($0.06 million) from last year,
	and interest income on other deposits decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	12 million ($0.18 million) on account of income tax refund received during
	previous year amounting to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	5 million ($ 0.76) and decrease in interest collected on deposits with third parties by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	7 million ($ 0.11 million) due to refund of deposits during current year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Finance expense:
</B>
	The finance expense
	primarily consists of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	126 million ($1.9 million) of interest expense on leases,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	86 million ($1.29 million) of interest
	paid on term loans from banks,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	127 million ($1.91 million) of interest paid on fund based working capital facilities from
	banks,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	17 million ($0.26 million) interest expense arising on account of loss on cross currency and interest rate swap transactions,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	83 million ($1.25 million) interest paid to other financial institutions and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	126 million ($1.9 million) of other
	borrowing costs paid in respect of utilization of non-fund facilities from the banks and other processing charges.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The company has raised new foreign currency
	term loans from banks amounting to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	601 million ($9.06 million) during the current
	year and working capital loans increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	194 million ($2.92 million) over
	fiscal 2015, resulting in increase in interest expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Year 2014-15 had a 23% growth with an increase
	in revenues of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	2,405 million ($38.4 million) contributed largely by Telecom Services with a revenue growth of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,586
	million ($25.3 million), and Technology Integration services with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	624 million ($10 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	follows:

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_16"></A>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Telecom Service increased
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,586 million ($25.3 million) primarily due to (i) an increase in revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	653 million ($10.4 million) from
	Connectivity Services, contributed by an increase in number of links by 8,704 with existing and new customer engagements, (ii)
	632 million ($10.0 million) revenue on account of large network integration project and (ii) an increase in revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	301
	million ($4.8 million) in Voice Services, which is on account of an increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	311 million ($4.97 million) from ILD business,
	contributed by volume increase of 1,266 million minutes, partially offset by reduction of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	10 million ($1.59 million) from
	VoIP services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Data Centre Services increased
	marginally by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	53 million ($0.8 million) due to increase in recovery rates
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Cloud and Managed
	Services increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	107 million ($1.7 million), primarily on account of
	an increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	97 million ($1.5 million) from cloud based offerings on
	account of new customer engagements and increase in Infrastructure managed services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	10
	million ($0.2 million) due to increase in customer engagements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Technology Integration Services
	increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	624 million ($10 million), on account of increase in revenues from large network integration and DC build contracts
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	377 million ($6 million) and increase in revenue of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	247 million ($4 million) from digital certification and Security
	Business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue from Applications Integration Services
	increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	35 million ($0.6 million). The increase is primarily attributable to increase in (i) Application services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	129 million ($2.1 million), which is on account of an increase in revenue by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	102 million ($1.6 million) from SAP
	and App-led SI and an increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	27 million ($0.4 million) on account of Online Assessment Services, which is offset by
	decrease of (i) e Learning business decrease by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	67 million ($1.07 million) on account of decrease in customer engagements
	and (ii) Portals business by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	27 million ($0.43 million) on account of decrease in customer engagements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Rental income has marginally increased
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1 Million ($0.02 million) and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	76 million ($1.2 million) increase towards reimbursement of investor related expenses
	pursuant to our ADS program, which was offset by decrease in write back of provisions and liabilities no longer required.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Network costs comprises cost of Bandwidth
	leased out from TELCOS, Inter connect charges and IP termination costs payable to carriers. Increase in Network costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	732 million ($12 million) is due to (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	143 million ($2.3 million) increase in Bandwidth costs incurred on account of capacity
	upgrades and newer links and (ii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	589 million ($9.4 million) of Inter connect charges due to the increase of 1,266 million
	minutes in the volume of International Long distance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue share cost comprises revenue share
	payable to DOT on licensed services. Increase in revenue share is on account of increase of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	92 million ($1.5 million) in
	the revenue share payable to DOT on account of increase in licensed Revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cost of Goods sold consists of cost of
	Hardware and Software including projects of Technology Integration business.&nbsp; Cost of Hardware and Software sold increased
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	247 million ($3.95 million) on account of increase in sale of digital signatures
	and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	295 million ($4.71 million) on account of increase in projects in Technology
	Integration business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Direct Resource costs comprises the cost
	of resources deployed on the Network Infrastructure Delivery (Part of Telecom service), and resources involved in delivery of
	applications integration services, cost of billable resources of e Learning (Part of Applications Integration services) and Infrastructure
	Managed services (Part of Cloud and Managed Services). Increase in resources costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	40 million ($0.6 million) is primarily on account of increase of (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	4
	million ($0.06 million) in resource cost of Managed services Delivery (Part of Cloud and Managed services), (ii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	49
	million ($0.78 million) increase in delivery telecom services on account of increase in number of employees and on account of
	rightsizing of Applications Integration Services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	9 million ($0.14 million)
	and Technology Integration Services by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	4 million ($0.05 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Power cost comprises electricity charges
	incurred for our Data Centre operations. Power cost increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	53 million ($0.85 million) due to full operation of Noida
	DC also increase in consumption in existing Datacenters and increased power tariff.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other direct costs comprises Link implementation
	and maintenance charges pertaining to Telecom services, direct cost of Applications Integration services business, digital certificate
	platform, content costs and subject matter experts for international businesses. The increase in other direct costs of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	131 million ($2.10 million) is primarily on account of increase of (i)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	128 million ($2.05 million) in applications integrations
	services on account of operating cost of online assessment and cost of delivering large projects (ii)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	13 million ($0.21
	million) on account of operating costs of cloud and managed services and.(iii) decrease of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	10 million ($0.16 million) on
	account of lower link maintenance charges.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	expenses

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating costs includes Rental, Repairs
	and Maintenance charges of our network operating centers, base stations and other co-location sites including the rent and maintenance
	for our Data Centres. Operating costs increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	42 million ($0.67 million) primarily on account of rent, repairs and
	maintenance and network operating cost which is due to increase in number of links and operating locations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Selling and Marketing expenses consist
	of, selling commission payable to sales partners, incentive to salesmen and, marketing and promotion costs. Selling and Marketing
	expenses is lower on account of lower marketing spend.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Associate expenses, consists of cost of
	the employees who are part of the Sales and marketing, Business development, General management and support services. Associate
	expense increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	216 million ($3.45 million) between two periods due to increase in headcount.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other indirect expense consists of, rental
	and electricity cost of office, travel cost, legal charges, professional charges, communication and others.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Allowance for doubtful receivables consists
	of the charge on account of the provisions created during the year against doubtful debtors. Allowance for doubtful receivables
	increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	53 million ($0.85 million) between two periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Depreciation and amortization
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As the business is continuing to expand,
	the amount of depreciation is increasing on account of constructing and deploying new facilities by the Company. Increase in depreciation
	is on account of leased assets taken for customer specific contracts by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	255 million ($4 million) during the fiscal 2015.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The increase in operating profit is primarily
	contributed by the decrease in selling, general and administrative expenses as a percentage of revenue. The percentage of selling
	general and administrative expenses on revenue for the fiscal 2015 is 24% as against 26% during the fiscal 2014. Also depreciation
	as a percentage of revenue has decreased by 0.64%.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Finance income:
</B>
	The finance income
	primarily consists of interest received from bank deposits of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	32 million ($0.51 million), interest received on IT refund
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	5 million ($0.08 million) and interest income on other deposits of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	12 million ($0.19 million). The interest received
	from bank decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	30 million ($0.48 Million) from last year, interest on income tax refund decreased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	35
	million ($0.56 million) since fiscal 2014 had additional income tax refunds relating to earlier years and interest income on other
	deposits increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	2 million ($0.03 million) on account of unwinding of fair valuation of deposits made.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Finance expense:
</B>
	The finance expense
	primarily consists of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	158 million ($2.5 million) of interest expense
	on leases,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	68 million ($1.0 million) of interest paid on term
	loans,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	111 million ($1.7 million) of interest paid on fund based
	working capital facilities from banks,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	75 million ($1.2 million)
	interest paid to other financial institutions and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	100 million
	($1.60 million) of other borrowing costs paid in respect of utilization of non fund facilities from the banks and other processing
	charges. The company has raised a new term loan during the year of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	225 million ($3.6 million) and hence, the interest on term loans has increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	`
</FONT>
	7 million ($0.1 million) over fiscal 2014. The interest on other borrowings increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	48 million ($0.77 million) and the interest expense on leases increased by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	68 million ($1.09 million) over fiscal 2014. The increase in borrowings from other financial institutions is primarily to fund
	our commitments relating to one of our large customer specific contract.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The
	increase in the net profit during the year 2014-15 was attributable to increase in revenue. However, due to higher finance costs,
	net profit has declined as a % of revenue. There has been higher pressure on margins due to price reductions and competition in
	the market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Foreign Exchange Fluctuations and Forwards
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We enter into foreign exchange derivative
	contracts to mitigate the risk of changes in foreign exchange rates on cash flows denominated in U.S. dollars. We enter into forward
	contracts and cross currency swaps where the counter party is a bank. Forward contracts generally mature between one to six months
	and Swap contracts cover a period of 5-6 years. These contracts do not qualify for hedge accounting under IFRS. These contracts
	are marked to market as at the balance sheet date and recognized in the consolidated income statement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Liquidity and capital resources
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We have financed our operations largely
	through cash generated from operations, equity issuance and bank borrowings. Our liquidity requirements are for meeting working
	capital needs and capital expenditures required to upgrade and maintain our existing infrastructure.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	flows for periods presented:

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of March 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 we
	had working capital of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,047 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,033
	million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,110 million which includes cash and cash equivalents of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,016
	million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	720 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	633
	million. Our working capital net of cash and cash equivalents is
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	31 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	313 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	477 million as
	of March 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014. We believe that cash from operations, existing lines of credit and capital availability from
	promotor group, we have sufficient resources to meet our liquidity requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our short term borrowings to finance working
	capital requirements are primarily financed by cash credit facilities with banks. Borrowings for capital expenditures are financed
	through capital leases and long term loans. We have foreign currency demand loans and cross currency swap for our term loan in
	Indian Rupee, which carry lower interest rates compared to loans to but are subject to exchange fluctuations, due to which there
	could be an adverse impact on cash outflows.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On October 22 2010, the company entered
	into a subscription agreement with Mr Ananda Raju Vegesna, acting as representative (the &ldquo;Representative&rdquo;) of the purchasers
	in connection with the offering. Pursuant to the terms of this subscription agreement, the company issued and allotted 125,000,000
	equity shares to an entity affiliated and controlled by Mr. Raju Vegesna, our CEO, Chairman and Managing Director. In accordance
	with Indian law, the purchase price is to be paid at such time as determined by Board of Directors of the company. During the fiscal
	year 2014, the Company has received an aggregate of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	300 million, in connection with this private placement, resulting in
	an aggregate of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	2,800 million received till date. Although all 125,000,000 shares are deemed issued and outstanding, the
	unpaid portion of the equity shares issued pursuant to the subscription agreement do not have any voting rights and are not entitled
	to dividends, if declared. As of the date of this Report, Mr. Vegesna has paid for 70% of the shares of the subscription
<B>
	.
</B>
	The
	balance of the proceeds from the allotment of the equity shares to our promoter group, or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,200 million, will take place
	in tranches as per the amended subscription agreement and the Board of Directors assessment from time to time of the Company&rsquo;s
	capital requirements, as regards both timing and amount. See note 37 in the notes to the financial statements included in this
	Annual Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We have borrowings of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	4,521 million
	as of March 31, 2016 out of which
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	3,130 million will be repaid within a period of 12 months. Interest outflow on existing
	borrowings for next year is expected to be
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	193 million. We have utilized working capital facility of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,675 million
	out of limit of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	1,750 million during fiscal 2016. We have unutilized non fund limit of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	768 million as of March
	31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our ongoing working capital requirements
	are significantly affected by the profitability of our operations and we continue to periodically evaluate existing and new sources
	of liquidity and financing. We are taking steps to improve the cash position to meet our currently known requirements at least
	over the next twelve months. In light of the highly dynamic nature of our business, however, we cannot assure you that our capital
	requirements and sources will not change significantly in the future.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash and cash equivalents:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash and cash equivalents comprise of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">

</FONT>
	865 million,

	`
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	613
	million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`

	611 million,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	510
	million in the form of bank deposits as on March 31, 2016, 2015, 2014 out of which cash deposits in the form of margin money is
	restricted for use by us amounting to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">

	We incurred
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: RUPEE FORADIAN">
	`
</FONT>
	2,811
	million (US$ 42.37 million) towards capital expenditure for the year ended March 31, 2016. We expect further capital expenditure
	to be incurred during the fiscal year 2017 to strengthen our infrastructure capabilities. The capital expenditure was funded out
	of internal accruals, bank borrowings and finance leasing arrangements.
</P>

<TD COLSPAN="2" NOWRAP STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	More
<BR>
	than 5
<BR>
	years
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
